whitelist:
# py-captions-for-channels Whitelist
# One rule per line. Format:
#   Simple: ShowName (substring match)
#   Regex: Pattern (regex if contains regex operators)
#   Complex: ShowName;DayOfWeek;Channel(s);Time
#
# Examples:
#   News                                  - matches any show containing "News"
#   ^CNN News                             - regex: matches titles starting with "CNN News"
#   News.*(Central|Night)                 - regex: matches "News" followed by "Central" or "Night"
#   Dateline;Friday;11.1,113;21:00       - only Fridays at 21:00 on channels 11.1 or 113
#
# Regex automatically detected by presence of: . * + ? ^ $ { } ( ) [ ] \ |
# All patterns are case-insensitive

# Time-specific shows (delayed captions on first run)
Dateline;Friday;11.1,113;21:00
48 hours;Saturday;5.1;22:00
20/20;Friday;7.1;21:00
20/20;Friday;7.1;22:00

# News programs (always benefit from captions)
News
Laura Coates
Entertainment Tonight
CNN NewsNight With Abby Phillip
Inside Edition
The Source With Kaitlan Collins
Erin Burnett OutFront
The Lead With Jake Tapper
The Arena With Kasie Hunt
Amanpour
Inside Politics With Dana Bash
The Situation Room
The Daily Show
The Rachel Maddow Show
CNN
60 Minutes
Fareed Zakaria GPS
Saturday Night Live
Anderson Cooper
Smerconish
The Late Show With Stephen Colbert
All In With Chris Hayes

# Special events
Awards
